intro: Ampelocissus urenifolia, commonly known as the African fig-leaf plant, is a climbing vine native to southern Africa. It features large, heart-shaped leaves that are often used in traditional medicine. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers followed by edible, fig-like fruits. Its vigorous growth habit makes it suitable for ornamental use in gardens and as a living fence. The leaves are also used to make baskets and other crafts in some regions.
